alert.note: Alert for Cochise; Santa Cruz (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 8:00PM MST until July 09 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Cochise County in southeastern Arizona... Eastern Santa Cruz County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 1100 PM MST. * At 800 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen in the upper Slaughter House Wash area east of Canelo and is expected to cause flash flooding in this wash. This will then drain into the Babocomari River just north of Huachuca City. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sierra Vista, Whetstone, Huachuca City, Fort Huachuca and Fairbank. This includes the following streams and drainages... Walnut Gulch, Turkey Creek, San Pedro River, Slaughter House Wash and Babocomari River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
